intro: Streblosa lampongensis, commonly known as the Lampongen stonecrop, is a unique succulent plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth pattern. The plant features thick, fleshy leaves that store water, enabling it to survive in arid and cold environments. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white and purple, typically blooming in early summer. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
